store_1.question: A list of the top 5 countries by number of invoices. List country name and number of invoices.
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country ,  COUNT(*) FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

store_1.question: What are the top 5 countries by number of invoices and how many do they have?
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country ,  COUNT(*) FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

store_1.question: A list of the top 8 countries by gross/total invoice size. List country name and gross invoice size.
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country ,  SUM(total) FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY SUM(total) DESC LIMIT 8;

store_1.question: What are the names of the top 8 countries by total invoice size and what are those sizes?
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country ,  SUM(total) FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY SUM(total) DESC LIMIT 8;

store_1.question: A list of the top 10 countries by average invoice size. List country name and average invoice size.
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country ,  AVG(total) FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY AVG(total) DESC LIMIT 10;

store_1.question: What are the names of the countries and average invoice size of the top countries by size?
store_1.query: SELECT billing_country ,  AVG(total) FROM invoices GROUP BY billing_country ORDER BY AVG(total) DESC LIMIT 10;

store_1.question: Find out 5 customers who most recently purchased something. List customers' first and last name.
store_1.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name FROM customers AS T1 JOIN invoices AS T2 ON T2.customer_id  =  T1.id ORDER BY T2.invoice_date DESC LIMIT 5;

store_1.question: What are the first and last names of the 5 customers who purchased something most recently?
store_1.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name FROM customers AS T1 JOIN invoices AS T2 ON T2.customer_id  =  T1.id ORDER BY T2.invoice_date DESC LIMIT 5;

store_1.question: Find out the top 10 customers by total number of orders. List customers' first and last name and the number of total orders.
store_1.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name ,  COUNT(*) FROM customers AS T1 JOIN invoices AS T2 ON T2.customer_id  =  T1.id GROUP BY T1.id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 10;

store_1.question: What are the top 10 customers' first and last names by total number of orders and how many orders did they make?
store_1.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.last_name ,  COUNT(*) FROM customers AS T1 JOIN invoices AS T2 ON T2.customer_id  =  T1.id GROUP BY T1.id ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 10;

store_1.question: List the top 10 customers by total gross sales. List customers' first and last name and total gross sales.

coffee_shop.question: How many members have the black membership card?

coffee_shop.query: SELECT count(*) ,  address FROM member GROUP BY address

coffee_shop.query: SELECT name FROM member WHERE address  =  'Harford' OR address  =  'Waterbury'

coffee_shop.query: SELECT name ,  member_id FROM member WHERE Membership_card  =  'Black' OR age  <  30

coffee_shop.query: SELECT Time_of_purchase ,  age ,  address FROM member ORDER BY Time_of_purchase

coffee_shop.query: SELECT Membership_card FROM member GROUP BY Membership_card HAVING count(*)  >  5

coffee_shop.question: Which address has both members younger than 30 and members older than 40?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT address FROM member WHERE age  <  30 INTERSECT SELECT address FROM member WHERE age  >  40

coffee_shop.question: What is the membership card held by both members living in Hartford and ones living in Waterbury address?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT membership_card FROM member WHERE address  =  'Hartford' INTERSECT SELECT membership_card FROM member WHERE address  =  'Waterbury'

coffee_shop.question: How many members are not living in Hartford?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT count(*) FROM member WHERE address != 'Hartford'

coffee_shop.question: Which address do not have any member with the black membership card?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT address FROM member EXCEPT SELECT address FROM member WHERE Membership_card  =  'Black'

coffee_shop.question: Show the shop addresses ordered by their opening year.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT address FROM shop ORDER BY open_year

coffee_shop.question: What are the average score and average staff number of all shops?
Find the id and address of the shops whose score is below the average score.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT shop_id ,  address FROM shop WHERE score  <  (SELECT avg(score) FROM shop)

coffee_shop.question: Find the address and staff number of the shops that do not have any happy hour.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT address ,  num_of_staff FROM shop WHERE shop_id NOT IN (SELECT shop_id FROM happy_hour)

coffee_shop.question: What are the id and address of the shops which have a happy hour in May?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT t1.address ,  t1.shop_id FROM shop AS t1 JOIN happy_hour AS t2 ON t1.shop_id  =  t2.shop_id WHERE MONTH  =  'May'

coffee_shop.question: which shop has happy hour most frequently? List its id and number of happy hours.
coffee_shop.query: SELECT shop_id ,  count(*) FROM happy_hour GROUP BY shop_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

coffee_shop.question: Which month has the most happy hours?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT MONTH FROM happy_hour GROUP BY MONTH ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

coffee_shop.question: Which months have more than 2 happy hours?
coffee_shop.query: SELECT MONTH FROM happy_hour GROUP BY MONTH HAVING count(*)  >  2

insurance_fnol.question: Find the name of services that have been used for more than 2 times in first notification of loss.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t2.service_name FROM first_notification_of_loss AS t1 JOIN services AS t2 ON t1.service_id  =  t2.service_id GROUP BY t1.service_id HAVING count(*)  >  2

insurance_fnol.question: Which services have been used more than twice in first notification of loss? Return the service name.

insurance_fnol.question: What is the effective date of the claim that has the largest amount of total settlement?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t1.Effective_Date FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id GROUP BY t1.claim_id ORDER BY sum(t2.settlement_amount) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_fnol.question: Find the claim that has the largest total settlement amount. Return the effective date of the claim.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t1.Effective_Date FROM claims AS t1 JOIN settlements AS t2 ON t1.claim_id  =  t2.claim_id GROUP BY t1.claim_id ORDER BY sum(t2.settlement_amount) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_fnol.question: Tell me the types of the policy used by the customer named "Dayana Robel".
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT t3.policy_type_code FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN available_policies AS t3 ON t2.policy_id  =  t3.policy_id WHERE t1.customer_name  =  "Dayana Robel"

insurance_fnol.question: What are all the policy types of the customer that has the most policies listed?
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT t3.policy_type_code FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN available_policies AS t3 ON t2.policy_id  =  t3.policy_id WHERE t1.customer_name  =  (SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id GROUP BY t1.customer_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

insurance_fnol.question: List all the policy types used by the customer enrolled in the most policies.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT DISTINCT t3.policy_type_code FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN available_policies AS t3 ON t2.policy_id  =  t3.policy_id WHERE t1.customer_name  =  (SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN customers_policies AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id GROUP BY t1.customer_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1)

insurance_fnol.question: Which customers do not have a first notification of loss record? Give me the customer names.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT customer_name FROM customers EXCEPT SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN first_notification_of_loss AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id

insurance_fnol.question: Find the names of customers who have used either the service "Close a policy" or the service "Upgrade a policy".
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN first_notification_of_loss AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN services AS t3 ON t2.service_id  =  t3.service_id WHERE t3.service_name  =  "Close a policy" OR t3.service_name  =  "Upgrade a policy"

insurance_fnol.question: Which customers have used the service named "Close a policy" or "Upgrade a policy"? Give me the customer names.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN first_notification_of_loss AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN services AS t3 ON t2.service_id  =  t3.service_id WHERE t3.service_name  =  "Close a policy" OR t3.service_name  =  "Upgrade a policy"

insurance_fnol.question: Find the names of customers who have used both the service "Close a policy" and the service "New policy application".
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN first_notification_of_loss AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN services AS t3 ON t2.service_id  =  t3.service_id WHERE t3.service_name  =  "Close a policy" INTERSECT SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN first_notification_of_loss AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN services AS t3 ON t2.service_id  =  t3.service_id WHERE t3.service_name  =  "New policy application"

insurance_fnol.question: Which customers have used both the service named "Close a policy" and the service named "Upgrade a policy"? Give me the customer names.
insurance_fnol.query: SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN first_notification_of_loss AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN services AS t3 ON t2.service_id  =  t3.service_id WHERE t3.service_name  =  "Close a policy" INTERSECT SELECT t1.customer_name FROM customers AS t1 JOIN first_notification_of_loss AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id JOIN services AS t3 ON t2.service_id  =  t3.service_id WHERE t3.service_name  =  "New policy application"

medicine_enzyme_interaction.question: What are the names of enzymes in the medicine named 'Amisulpride' that can serve as an 'inhibitor'?
medicine_enzyme_interaction.query: SELECT T1.name FROM enzyme AS T1 JOIN medicine_enzyme_interaction AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.enzyme_id JOIN medicine AS T3 ON T2.medicine_id  =  T3.id WHERE T3.name  =  'Amisulpride' AND T2.interaction_type  =  'inhibitor'

medicine_enzyme_interaction.question: What are the names of the enzymes used in the medicine  Amisulpride that acts as inhibitors?

medicine_enzyme_interaction.question: What are the ids and names of the medicine that can interact with two or more enzymes?
medicine_enzyme_interaction.query: SELECT T1.id ,  T1.Name FROM medicine AS T1 JOIN medicine_enzyme_interaction AS T2 ON T2.medicine_id  =  T1.id GROUP BY T1.id HAVING count(*)  >=  2

phone_1.question: Which model has the least amount of RAM? List the model name and the amount of RAM.
phone_1.query: SELECT Model_name ,  RAM_MiB FROM chip_model ORDER BY RAM_MiB ASC LIMIT 1;

phone_1.question: What are the chip model and screen mode of the phone with hardware model name "LG-P760"?
phone_1.query: SELECT chip_model ,  screen_mode FROM phone WHERE Hardware_Model_name = "LG-P760";

phone_1.question: How many phone hardware models are produced by the company named "Nokia Corporation"?
phone_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM phone WHERE Company_name = "Nokia Corporation";

phone_1.question: What is maximum and minimum RAM size of phone produced by company named "Nokia Corporation"?
phone_1.query: SELECT max(T1.RAM_MiB) ,  min(T1.RAM_MiB) FROM chip_model AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Model_name  =  T2.chip_model WHERE T2.Company_name = "Nokia Corporation";

phone_1.question: What is the average ROM size of phones produced by the company named "Nokia Corporation"?
phone_1.query: SELECT avg(T1.ROM_MiB) FROM chip_model AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Model_name  =  T2.chip_model WHERE T2.Company_name = "Nokia Corporation";

phone_1.question: List the hardware model name and company name for all the phones that were launched in year 2002 or have RAM size greater than 32.
phone_1.query: SELECT T2.Hardware_Model_name ,  T2.Company_name FROM chip_model AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Model_name  =  T2.chip_model WHERE T1.Launch_year = 2002 OR T1.RAM_MiB  >  32;

phone_1.question: Find all phones that have word 'Full' in their accreditation types. List the Hardware Model name and Company name.
phone_1.query: SELECT Hardware_Model_name ,  Company_name FROM phone WHERE Accreditation_type LIKE 'Full';

phone_1.question: Find the Char cells, Pixels and Hardware colours for the screen of the phone whose hardware model name is "LG-P760".
phone_1.query: SELECT T1.Char_cells ,  T1.Pixels ,  T1.Hardware_colours FROM screen_mode AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Graphics_mode = T2.screen_mode WHERE T2.Hardware_Model_name = "LG-P760";

phone_1.question: List the hardware model name and company name for the phone whose screen mode type is "Graphics."
phone_1.query: SELECT T2.Hardware_Model_name ,  T2.Company_name FROM screen_mode AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Graphics_mode = T2.screen_mode WHERE T1.Type  =  "Graphics";

phone_1.question: Find the name of the company that has the least number of phone models. List the company name and the number of phone model produced by that company.
phone_1.query: SELECT Company_name ,  count(*) FROM phone GROUP BY Company_name ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1;

phone_1.question: List the name of the company that produced more than one phone model.
phone_1.query: SELECT Company_name FROM phone GROUP BY Company_name HAVING count(*)  >  1;

phone_1.question: List the maximum, minimum and average number of used kb in screen mode.
phone_1.query: SELECT max(used_kb) , min(used_kb) , avg(used_kb) FROM screen_mode;

phone_1.question: List the name of the phone model launched in year 2002 and with the highest RAM size.
phone_1.query: SELECT T2.Hardware_Model_name FROM chip_model AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Model_name  =  T2.chip_model WHERE T1.Launch_year = 2002 ORDER BY T1.RAM_MiB DESC LIMIT 1;

phone_1.question: What are the wifi and screen mode type of the hardware model named "LG-P760"?
phone_1.query: SELECT T1.WiFi , T3.Type FROM chip_model AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Model_name  =  T2.chip_model JOIN screen_mode AS T3 ON T2.screen_mode = T3.Graphics_mode WHERE T2.Hardware_Model_name = "LG-P760";

phone_1.question: List the hardware model name for the phones that have screen mode type "Text" or RAM size greater than 32.
phone_1.query: SELECT T2.Hardware_Model_name FROM chip_model AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Model_name  =  T2.chip_model JOIN screen_mode AS T3 ON T2.screen_mode = T3.Graphics_mode WHERE T3.Type = "Text" OR T1.RAM_MiB  >  32;

phone_1.question: List the hardware model name for the phones that were produced by "Nokia Corporation" or whose screen mode type is "Graphics."
phone_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.Hardware_Model_name FROM screen_mode AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Graphics_mode = T2.screen_mode WHERE T1.Type  =  "Graphics" OR t2.Company_name  =  "Nokia Corporation"

phone_1.question: List the hardware model name for the phons that were produced by "Nokia Corporation" but whose screen mode type is not Text.
phone_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.Hardware_Model_name FROM screen_mode AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Graphics_mode = T2.screen_mode WHERE t2.Company_name  =  "Nokia Corporation" AND T1.Type != "Text";

phone_1.question: List the phone hardware model and company name for the phones whose screen usage in kb is between 10 and 15.
phone_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.Hardware_Model_name , T2.Company_name FROM screen_mode AS T1 JOIN phone AS T2 ON T1.Graphics_mode = T2.screen_mode WHERE T1.used_kb BETWEEN 10 AND 15;

phone_1.question: Find the number of phones for each accreditation type.
phone_1.query: SELECT Accreditation_type ,  count(*) FROM phone GROUP BY Accreditation_type

phone_1.question: How many phones belongs to each accreditation type?
phone_1.query: SELECT Accreditation_type ,  count(*) FROM phone GROUP BY Accreditation_type

phone_1.question: Find the accreditation level that more than 3 phones use.
phone_1.query: SELECT Accreditation_level FROM phone GROUP BY Accreditation_level HAVING count(*)  >  3

phone_1.question: Find the details for all chip models.
phone_1.query: SELECT * FROM chip_model

phone_1.question: How many models do not have the wifi function?
phone_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM chip_model WHERE wifi  =  'No'

phone_1.question: Count the number of chip model that do not have wifi.
phone_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM chip_model WHERE wifi  =  'No'

phone_1.question: List all the model names sorted by their launch year.
phone_1.query: SELECT model_name FROM chip_model ORDER BY launch_year

phone_1.question: Find the average ram mib size of the chip models that are never used by any phone.
phone_1.query: SELECT avg(RAM_MiB) FROM chip_model WHERE model_name NOT IN (SELECT chip_model FROM phone)

phone_1.question: Find the names of the chip models that are not used by any phone with full accreditation type.
phone_1.query: SELECT model_name FROM chip_model EXCEPT SELECT chip_model FROM phone WHERE Accreditation_type  =  'Full'

phone_1.question: Find the pixels of the screen modes that are used by both phones with full accreditation types and phones with Provisional accreditation types.
phone_1.query: SELECT t1.pixels FROM screen_mode AS t1 JOIN phone AS t2 ON t1.Graphics_mode  =  t2.screen_mode WHERE t2.Accreditation_type  =  'Provisional' INTERSECT SELECT t1.pixels FROM screen_mode AS t1 JOIN phone AS t2 ON t1.Graphics_mode  =  t2.screen_mode WHERE t2.Accreditation_type  =  'Full'

body_builder.query: SELECT T2.Birth_Date ,  T2.Birth_Place FROM body_builder AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.People_ID  =  T2.People_ID ORDER BY T1.Total DESC LIMIT 1

body_builder.question: What are the heights of body builders with total score smaller than 315?
body_builder.query: SELECT T2.Height FROM body_builder AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.People_ID  =  T2.People_ID WHERE T1.Total  <  315

body_builder.question: What is the average total score of body builders with height bigger than 200?
body_builder.query: SELECT avg(T1.Total) FROM body_builder AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.People_ID  =  T2.People_ID WHERE T2.Height  >  200

body_builder.question: What are the names of body builders in descending order of total scores?
body_builder.query: SELECT T2.Name FROM body_builder AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.People_ID  =  T2.People_ID ORDER BY T1.Total DESC

body_builder.question: List each birth place along with the number of people from there.
body_builder.query: SELECT Birth_Place ,  COUNT(*) FROM people GROUP BY Birth_Place

body_builder.question: What is the most common birth place of people?
body_builder.query: SELECT Birth_Place FROM people GROUP BY Birth_Place ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

body_builder.question: What are the birth places that are shared by at least two people?
body_builder.query: SELECT Birth_Place FROM people GROUP BY Birth_Place HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  2

body_builder.question: List the height and weight of people in descending order of height.
body_builder.query: SELECT Height ,  Weight FROM people ORDER BY Height DESC

body_builder.question: Show all information about each body builder.
body_builder.query: SELECT * FROM body_builder

body_builder.question: List the names and origins of people who are not body builders.
body_builder.query: SELECT Name ,  birth_place FROM people EXCEPT SELECT T1.Name ,  T1.birth_place FROM people AS T1 JOIN body_builder AS T2 ON T1.people_id  =  T2.people_id

body_builder.question: How many distinct birth places are there?
body_builder.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT Birth_Place) FROM people

body_builder.question: How many persons are not body builders?
body_builder.query: SELECT count(*) FROM people WHERE people_id NOT IN (SELECT People_ID FROM body_builder)

body_builder.question: List the weight of the body builders who have snatch score higher than 140 or have the height greater than 200.
body_builder.query: SELECT T2.weight FROM body_builder AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.people_id  =  T2.people_id WHERE T1.snatch  >  140 OR T2.height  >  200;

body_builder.question: What are the total scores of the body builders whose birthday contains the string "January" ?
body_builder.query: SELECT T1.total FROM body_builder AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.people_id  =  T2.people_id WHERE T2.Birth_Date LIKE "%January%";

body_builder.question: What is the minimum snatch score?
body_builder.query: SELECT min(snatch) FROM body_builder

election_representative.question: How many elections are there?
election_representative.query: SELECT count(*) FROM election

election_representative.question: List the votes of elections in descending order.
election_representative.query: SELECT Votes FROM election ORDER BY Votes DESC

election_representative.question: List the dates and vote percents of elections.
election_representative.query: SELECT Date ,  Vote_Percent FROM election

election_representative.question: What are the minimum and maximum vote percents of elections?
election_representative.query: SELECT min(Vote_Percent) ,  max(Vote_Percent) FROM election

election_representative.question: What are the names and parties of representatives?
election_representative.query: SELECT Name ,  Party FROM representative

election_representative.question: What are the names of representatives whose party is not "Republican"?
election_representative.query: SELECT Name FROM Representative WHERE Party != "Republican"

election_representative.question: What are the life spans of representatives from New York state or Indiana state?
election_representative.query: SELECT Lifespan FROM representative WHERE State  =  "New York" OR State  =  "Indiana"

election_representative.question: What are the names of representatives and the dates of elections they participated in.
election_representative.query: SELECT T2.Name ,  T1.Date FROM election AS T1 JOIN representative AS T2 ON T1.Representative_ID  =  T2.Representative_ID

election_representative.question: What are the names of representatives with more than 10000 votes in election?
election_representative.query: SELECT T2.Name FROM election AS T1 JOIN representative AS T2 ON T1.Representative_ID  =  T2.Representative_ID WHERE Votes  >  10000

election_representative.question: What are the names of representatives in descending order of votes?
election_representative.query: SELECT T2.Name FROM election AS T1 JOIN representative AS T2 ON T1.Representative_ID  =  T2.Representative_ID ORDER BY votes DESC

election_representative.question: What is the party of the representative that has the smallest number of votes.
election_representative.query: SELECT T2.Party FROM election AS T1 JOIN representative AS T2 ON T1.Representative_ID  =  T2.Representative_ID ORDER BY votes ASC LIMIT 1

election_representative.question: What are the lifespans of representatives in descending order of vote percent?
election_representative.query: SELECT T2.Lifespan FROM election AS T1 JOIN representative AS T2 ON T1.Representative_ID  =  T2.Representative_ID ORDER BY Vote_Percent DESC

election_representative.question: What is the average number of votes of representatives from party "Republican"?
election_representative.query: SELECT avg(T1.Votes) FROM election AS T1 JOIN representative AS T2 ON T1.Representative_ID  =  T2.Representative_ID WHERE T2.Party  =  "Republican"

election_representative.question: What are the different parties of representative? Show the party name and the number of representatives in each party.
election_representative.query: SELECT Party ,  COUNT(*) FROM representative GROUP BY Party

election_representative.question: What is the party that has the largest number of representatives?
election_representative.query: SELECT Party ,  COUNT(*) FROM representative GROUP BY Party ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

election_representative.question: What parties have at least three representatives?
election_representative.query: SELECT Party FROM representative GROUP BY Party HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  3

election_representative.question: What states have at least two representatives?
election_representative.query: SELECT State FROM representative GROUP BY State HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  2

election_representative.question: List the names of representatives that have not participated in elections listed here.
election_representative.query: SELECT Name FROM representative WHERE Representative_ID NOT IN (SELECT Representative_ID FROM election)

election_representative.question: Show the parties that have both representatives in New York state and representatives in Pennsylvania state.
election_representative.query: SELECT Party FROM representative WHERE State  =  "New York" INTERSECT SELECT Party FROM representative WHERE State  =  "Pennsylvania"

election_representative.question: How many distinct parties are there for representatives?
election_representative.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT Party) FROM representative

game_injury.question: What are the maximum, minimum and average home games each stadium held?
game_injury.query: SELECT max(home_games) ,  min(home_games) ,  avg(home_games) FROM stadium

game_injury.question: What is the average attendance of stadiums with capacity percentage higher than 100%?
game_injury.query: SELECT average_attendance FROM stadium WHERE capacity_percentage  >  100

game_injury.question: What are the player name, number of matches, and information source for players who do not suffer from injury of 'Knee problem'?
game_injury.query: SELECT player ,  number_of_matches ,  SOURCE FROM injury_accident WHERE injury != 'Knee problem'

game_injury.question: What is the season of the game which causes the player 'Walter Samuel' to get injured?
game_injury.query: SELECT T1.season FROM game AS T1 JOIN injury_accident AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.game_id WHERE T2.player  =  'Walter Samuel'

game_injury.question: What are the ids, scores, and dates of the games which caused at least two injury accidents?
game_injury.query: SELECT T1.id ,  T1.score ,  T1.date FROM game AS T1 JOIN injury_accident AS T2 ON T2.game_id  =  T1.id GROUP BY T1.id HAVING count(*)  >=  2

game_injury.question: What are the id and name of the stadium where the most injury accidents happened?
game_injury.query: SELECT T1.id ,  T1.name FROM stadium AS T1 JOIN game AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.stadium_id JOIN injury_accident AS T3 ON T2.id  =  T3.game_id GROUP BY T1.id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

game_injury.question: Find the id and name of the stadium where the largest number of injury accidents occurred.
game_injury.query: SELECT T1.id ,  T1.name FROM stadium AS T1 JOIN game AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.stadium_id JOIN injury_accident AS T3 ON T2.id  =  T3.game_id GROUP BY T1.id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

game_injury.question: In which season and which stadium did any player have an injury of 'Foot injury' or 'Knee problem'?
game_injury.query: SELECT T1.season ,  T2.name FROM game AS T1 JOIN stadium AS T2 ON T1.stadium_id  =  T2.id JOIN injury_accident AS T3 ON T1.id  =  T3.game_id WHERE T3.injury  =  'Foot injury' OR T3.injury  =  'Knee problem'

game_injury.question: How many different kinds of information sources are there for injury accidents?
How many games are free of injury accidents?
game_injury.query: SELECT count(*) FROM game WHERE id NOT IN ( SELECT game_id FROM injury_accident )

game_injury.question: How many distinct kinds of injuries happened after season 2010?
game_injury.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT T1.injury) FROM injury_accident AS T1 JOIN game AS T2 ON T1.game_id  =  T2.id WHERE T2.season  >  2010

game_injury.question: List the name of the stadium where both the player 'Walter Samuel' and the player 'Thiago Motta' got injured.
game_injury.query: SELECT T2.name FROM game AS T1 JOIN stadium AS T2 ON T1.stadium_id  =  T2.id JOIN injury_accident AS T3 ON T1.id  =  T3.game_id WHERE T3.player  =  'Walter Samuel' INTERSECT SELECT T2.name FROM game AS T1 JOIN stadium AS T2 ON T1.stadium_id  =  T2.id JOIN injury_accident AS T3 ON T1.id  =  T3.game_id WHERE T3.player  =  'Thiago Motta'

game_injury.question: Show the name, average attendance, total attendance for stadiums where no accidents happened.
game_injury.query: SELECT name ,  average_attendance ,  total_attendance FROM stadium EXCEPT SELECT T2.name ,  T2.average_attendance ,  T2.total_attendance FROM game AS T1 JOIN stadium AS T2 ON T1.stadium_id  =  T2.id JOIN injury_accident AS T3 ON T1.id  =  T3.game_id

game_injury.question: Which stadium name contains the substring "Bank"?
game_injury.query: SELECT name FROM stadium WHERE name LIKE "%Bank%"

game_injury.question: How many games has each stadium held?
game_injury.query: SELECT T1.id ,  count(*) FROM stadium AS T1 JOIN game AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.stadium_id GROUP BY T1.id

game_injury.question: For each injury accident, find the date of the game and the name of the injured player in the game, and sort the results in descending order of game season.
game_injury.query: SELECT T1.date ,  T2.player FROM game AS T1 JOIN injury_accident AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.game_id ORDER BY T1.season DESC

soccer_1.question: List all country and league names.
soccer_1.query: SELECT T1.name ,  T2.name FROM Country AS T1 JOIN League AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.country_id

soccer_1.question: How many leagues are there in England?
soccer_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Country AS T1 JOIN League AS T2 ON T1.id  =  T2.country_id WHERE T1.name  =  "England"

soccer_1.question: What is the average weight of all players?
What is the maximum and minimum height of all players?
List all player names who have an overall rating higher than the average.
soccer_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.player_name FROM Player AS T1 JOIN Player_Attributes AS T2 ON T1.player_api_id = T2.player_api_id WHERE T2.overall_rating  >  ( SELECT avg(overall_rating) FROM Player_Attributes )

soccer_1.question: What are the names of players who have the best dribbling?
soccer_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.player_name FROM Player AS T1 JOIN Player_Attributes AS T2 ON T1.player_api_id = T2.player_api_id WHERE T2.dribbling  =  ( SELECT max(overall_rating) FROM Player_Attributes)

soccer_1.question: List the names of all players who have a crossing score higher than 90 and prefer their right foot.
soccer_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.player_name FROM Player AS T1 JOIN Player_Attributes AS T2 ON T1.player_api_id = T2.player_api_id WHERE T2.crossing  >  90 AND T2.preferred_foot  =  "right"

soccer_1.question: List the names of all left-footed players who have overall rating between 85 and 90.
soccer_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.player_name FROM Player AS T1 JOIN Player_Attributes AS T2 ON T1.player_api_id = T2.player_api_id WHERE T2.preferred_foot  =  "left" AND T2.overall_rating  >=  85 AND T2.overall_rating  <=  90

soccer_1.question: What is the average rating for right-footed players and left-footed players?
soccer_1.query: SELECT preferred_foot ,  avg(overall_rating) FROM Player_Attributes GROUP BY preferred_foot

soccer_1.question: Of all players with an overall rating greater than 80, how many are right-footed and left-footed?
soccer_1.query: SELECT preferred_foot ,  count(*) FROM Player_Attributes WHERE overall_rating  >  80 GROUP BY preferred_foot

soccer_1.question: List all of the player ids with a height of at least 180cm and an overall rating higher than 85.
soccer_1.query: SELECT player_api_id FROM Player WHERE height  >=  180 INTERSECT SELECT player_api_id FROM Player_Attributes WHERE overall_rating  >  85

soccer_1.question: List all of the ids for left-footed players with a height between 180cm and 190cm.
soccer_1.query: SELECT player_api_id FROM Player WHERE height  >=  180 AND height  <=  190 INTERSECT SELECT player_api_id FROM Player_Attributes WHERE preferred_foot  =  "left"

soccer_1.question: Who are the top 3 players in terms of overall rating?
soccer_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.player_name FROM Player AS T1 JOIN Player_Attributes AS T2 ON T1.player_api_id  =  T2.player_api_id ORDER BY overall_rating DESC LIMIT 3

soccer_1.question: List the names and birthdays of the top five players in terms of potential.
soccer_1.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.player_name ,  T1.birthday FROM Player AS T1 JOIN Player_Attributes AS T2 ON T1.player_api_id  =  T2.player_api_id ORDER BY potential DESC LIMIT 5

performance_attendance.question: List the hosts of performances in ascending order of attendance.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT HOST FROM performance ORDER BY Attendance ASC

performance_attendance.question: What are the dates and locations of performances?
Show the attendances of the performances at location "TD Garden" or "Bell Centre"
performance_attendance.query: SELECT Attendance FROM performance WHERE LOCATION  =  "TD Garden" OR LOCATION  =  "Bell Centre"

performance_attendance.question: What is the average number of attendees for performances?
What is the date of the performance with the highest number of attendees?
performance_attendance.query: SELECT Date FROM performance ORDER BY Attendance DESC LIMIT 1

performance_attendance.question: Show different locations and the number of performances at each location.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT LOCATION ,  COUNT(*) FROM performance GROUP BY LOCATION

performance_attendance.question: Show the most common location of performances.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT LOCATION FROM performance GROUP BY LOCATION ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

performance_attendance.question: Show the locations that have at least two performances.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT LOCATION FROM performance GROUP BY LOCATION HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  2

performance_attendance.question: Show the locations that have both performances with more than 2000 attendees and performances with less than 1000 attendees.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT LOCATION FROM performance WHERE Attendance  >  2000 INTERSECT SELECT LOCATION FROM performance WHERE Attendance  <  1000

performance_attendance.question: Show the names of members and the location of the performances they attended.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT T2.Name ,  T3.Location FROM member_attendance AS T1 JOIN member AS T2 ON T1.Member_ID  =  T2.Member_ID JOIN performance AS T3 ON T1.Performance_ID  =  T3.Performance_ID

performance_attendance.question: Show the names of members and the location of performances they attended in ascending alphabetical order of their names.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT T2.Name ,  T3.Location FROM member_attendance AS T1 JOIN member AS T2 ON T1.Member_ID  =  T2.Member_ID JOIN performance AS T3 ON T1.Performance_ID  =  T3.Performance_ID ORDER BY T2.Name ASC

performance_attendance.question: Show the dates of performances with attending members whose roles are "Violin".
performance_attendance.query: SELECT T3.Date FROM member_attendance AS T1 JOIN member AS T2 ON T1.Member_ID  =  T2.Member_ID JOIN performance AS T3 ON T1.Performance_ID  =  T3.Performance_ID WHERE T2.Role  =  "Violin"

performance_attendance.question: Show the names of members and the dates of performances they attended in descending order of attendance of the performances.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT T2.Name ,  T3.Date FROM member_attendance AS T1 JOIN member AS T2 ON T1.Member_ID  =  T2.Member_ID JOIN performance AS T3 ON T1.Performance_ID  =  T3.Performance_ID ORDER BY T3.Attendance DESC

performance_attendance.question: List the names of members who did not attend any performance.
performance_attendance.query: SELECT Name FROM member WHERE Member_ID NOT IN (SELECT Member_ID FROM member_attendance)

college_2.question: What is the title and credits of the course that is taught in the largest classroom (with the highest capacity)?
college_2.query: SELECT T3.title ,  T3.credits FROM classroom AS T1 JOIN SECTION AS T2 ON T1.building  =  T2.building AND T1.room_number  =  T2.room_number JOIN course AS T3 ON T2.course_id  =  T3.course_id WHERE T1.capacity  =  (SELECT max(capacity) FROM classroom)

college_2.question: Give the title and credits for the course that is taught in the classroom with the greatest capacity.

debate.question: List the venues of debates in ascending order of the number of audience.
debate.query: SELECT Venue FROM debate ORDER BY Num_of_Audience ASC

debate.question: What are the date and venue of each debate?
List the dates of debates with number of audience bigger than 150
debate.query: SELECT Date FROM debate WHERE Num_of_Audience  >  150

debate.question: Show the names of people aged either 35 or 36.
debate.query: SELECT Name FROM  people WHERE Age  =  35 OR Age  =  36

debate.question: What is the party of the youngest people?
debate.query: SELECT Party FROM people ORDER BY Age ASC LIMIT 1

debate.question: Show different parties of people along with the number of people in each party.
debate.query: SELECT Party ,  COUNT(*) FROM people GROUP BY Party

debate.question: Show the party that has the most people.
debate.query: SELECT Party FROM people GROUP BY Party ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

debate.question: Show the distinct venues of debates
Show the names of people, and dates and venues of debates they are on the affirmative side.
debate.query: SELECT T3.Name ,  T2.Date ,  T2.Venue FROM debate_people AS T1 JOIN debate AS T2 ON T1.Debate_ID  =  T2.Debate_ID JOIN people AS T3 ON T1.Affirmative  =  T3.People_ID

debate.question: Show the names of people, and dates and venues of debates they are on the negative side, ordered in ascending alphabetical order of name.
debate.query: SELECT T3.Name ,  T2.Date ,  T2.Venue FROM debate_people AS T1 JOIN debate AS T2 ON T1.Debate_ID  =  T2.Debate_ID JOIN people AS T3 ON T1.Negative  =  T3.People_ID ORDER BY T3.Name ASC

debate.question: Show the names of people that are on affirmative side of debates with number of audience bigger than 200.
debate.query: SELECT T3.Name FROM debate_people AS T1 JOIN debate AS T2 ON T1.Debate_ID  =  T2.Debate_ID JOIN people AS T3 ON T1.Affirmative  =  T3.People_ID WHERE T2.Num_of_Audience  >  200

debate.question: Show the names of people and the number of times they have been on the affirmative side of debates.
debate.query: SELECT T2.Name ,  COUNT(*) FROM debate_people AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.Affirmative  =  T2.People_ID GROUP BY T2.Name

debate.question: Show the names of people who have been on the negative side of debates at least twice.
debate.query: SELECT T2.Name FROM debate_people AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.Negative  =  T2.People_ID GROUP BY T2.Name HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  2

debate.question: List the names of people that have not been on the affirmative side of debates.
debate.query: SELECT Name FROM people WHERE People_id NOT IN (SELECT Affirmative FROM debate_people)

insurance_and_eClaims.question: What are the type codes of the policies used by the customer "Dayana Robel"?
insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM policies AS t1 JOIN customers AS t2 ON t1.customer_id  =  t2.customer_id WHERE t2.customer_details  =  "Dayana Robel"

insurance_and_eClaims.question: Which type of policy is most frequently used? Give me the policy type code.
insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT policy_type_code FROM policies GROUP BY policy_type_code ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

insurance_and_eClaims.question: Find the total and average amount paid in claim headers.
insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT sum(amount_piad) ,  avg(amount_piad) FROM claim_headers

insurance_and_eClaims.question: What are the total amount and average amount paid in claim headers?
insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT sum(amount_piad) ,  avg(amount_piad) FROM claim_headers

insurance_and_eClaims.question: Find the total amount claimed in the most recently created document.
insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT sum(t1.amount_claimed) FROM claim_headers AS t1 JOIN claims_documents AS t2 ON t1.claim_header_id  =  t2.claim_id WHERE t2.created_date  =  (SELECT created_date FROM claims_documents ORDER BY created_date LIMIT 1)

insurance_and_eClaims.question: How much amount in total were claimed in the most recently created document?
insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT sum(t1.amount_claimed) FROM claim_headers AS t1 JOIN claims_documents AS t2 ON t1.claim_header_id  =  t2.claim_id WHERE t2.created_date  =  (SELECT created_date FROM claims_documents ORDER BY created_date LIMIT 1)

insurance_and_eClaims.question: What is the name of the customer who has made the largest amount of claim in a single claim?
insurance_and_eClaims.query: SELECT t3.customer_details FROM claim_headers AS t1 JOIN policies AS t2 ON t1.policy_id  =  t2.policy_id JOIN customers AS t3 ON t2.customer_id  =  t3.customer_id WHERE t1.amount_claimed  =  (SELECT max(amount_claimed) FROM claim_headers)

insurance_and_eClaims.question: Which customer made the largest amount of claim in a single claim? Return the customer details.

customers_and_invoices.query: SELECT order_id ,  count(DISTINCT product_id) FROM Order_items GROUP BY order_id

customers_and_invoices.question: Show order ids and the total quantity in each order.
customers_and_invoices.query: SELECT order_id ,  sum(product_quantity) FROM Order_items GROUP BY order_id

customers_and_invoices.question: Give the order ids for all orders, as well as the total product quantity in each.
customers_and_invoices.query: SELECT order_id ,  sum(product_quantity) FROM Order_items GROUP BY order_id

customers_and_invoices.question: How many products were not included in any order?
customers_and_invoices.query: SELECT count(*) FROM products WHERE product_id NOT IN ( SELECT product_id FROM Order_items )

customers_and_invoices.question: Count the number of products that were never ordered.
customers_and_invoices.query: SELECT count(*) FROM products WHERE product_id NOT IN ( SELECT product_id FROM Order_items )

wedding.question: How many churches opened before 1850 are there?
wedding.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Church WHERE Open_Date  <  1850

wedding.question: Show the name, open date, and organizer for all churches.
wedding.query: SELECT name ,  open_date ,  organized_by FROM Church

wedding.question: List all church names in descending order of opening date.
wedding.query: SELECT name FROM church ORDER BY open_date DESC

wedding.question: Show the opening year in whcih at least two churches opened.
wedding.query: SELECT open_date FROM church GROUP BY open_date HAVING count(*)  >=  2

wedding.question: Show the organizer and name for churches that opened between 1830 and 1840.
wedding.query: SELECT organized_by ,  name FROM church WHERE open_date BETWEEN 1830 AND 1840

wedding.question: Show all opening years and the number of churches that opened in that year.
wedding.query: SELECT open_date ,  count(*) FROM church GROUP BY open_date

wedding.question: Show the name and opening year for three churches that opened most recently.
wedding.query: SELECT name ,  open_date FROM church ORDER BY open_date DESC LIMIT 3

wedding.question: How many female people are older than 30 in our record?
wedding.query: SELECT count(*) FROM people WHERE is_male  =  'F' AND age  >  30

wedding.question: Show the country where people older than 30 and younger than 25 are from.
wedding.query: SELECT country FROM people WHERE age  <  25 INTERSECT SELECT country FROM people WHERE age  >  30

wedding.question: Show the minimum, maximum, and average age for all people.
wedding.query: SELECT min(age) ,  max(age) ,  avg(age) FROM people

wedding.question: Show the name and country for all people whose age is smaller than the average.
wedding.query: SELECT name ,  country FROM people WHERE age  <  (SELECT avg(age) FROM people)

wedding.question: Show the pair of male and female names in all weddings after year 2014
wedding.query: SELECT T2.name ,  T3.name FROM wedding AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.male_id  =  T2.people_id JOIN people AS T3 ON T1.female_id  =  T3.people_id WHERE T1.year  >  2014

wedding.question: Show the name and age for all male people who don't have a wedding.
wedding.query: SELECT name ,  age FROM people WHERE is_male  =  'T' AND people_id NOT IN (SELECT male_id FROM wedding)

wedding.question: Show all church names except for those that had a wedding in year 2015.
wedding.query: SELECT name FROM church EXCEPT SELECT T1.name FROM church AS T1 JOIN wedding AS T2 ON T1.church_id  =  T2.church_id WHERE T2.year  =  2015

wedding.question: Show all church names that have hosted least two weddings.
wedding.query: SELECT T1.name FROM church AS T1 JOIN wedding AS T2 ON T1.church_id  =  T2.church_id GROUP BY T1.church_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2

wedding.question: Show the names for all females from Canada having a wedding in year 2016.
wedding.query: SELECT T2.name FROM wedding AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.female_id  =  T2.people_id WHERE T1.year  =  2016 AND T2.is_male  =  'F' AND T2.country  =  'Canada'

wedding.question: How many weddings are there in year 2016?
wedding.query: SELECT count(*) FROM wedding WHERE YEAR  =  2016

wedding.question: Show the church names for the weddings of all people older than 30.
wedding.query: SELECT T4.name FROM wedding AS T1 JOIN people AS T2 ON T1.male_id  =  T2.people_id JOIN people AS T3 ON T1.female_id  =  T3.people_id JOIN church AS T4 ON T4.church_id  =  T1.church_id WHERE T2.age  >  30 OR T3.age  >  30

wedding.question: Show all countries and the number of people from each country.
wedding.query: SELECT country ,  count(*) FROM people GROUP BY country

wedding.question: How many churches have a wedding in year 2016?
wedding.query: SELECT COUNT (DISTINCT church_id) FROM wedding WHERE YEAR  =  2016

theme_gallery.question: How many artists do we have?

theme_gallery.question: Count the number of artists.

theme_gallery.question: What are the names, ages, and countries of artists, sorted by the year they joined?

theme_gallery.question: What are all distinct country for artists?

theme_gallery.question: Return the different countries for artists.

theme_gallery.question: Show all artist names and the year joined who are not from United States.

theme_gallery.question: What are the names and year of joining for artists that do not have the country "United States"?

theme_gallery.question: Count the number of artists who are older than 46 and joined after 1990.

theme_gallery.question: What is the average and minimum age of all artists from United States.

theme_gallery.question: Return the average and minimum ages across artists from the United States.

theme_gallery.question: What is the name of the artist who joined latest?

theme_gallery.question: Return the name of the artist who has the latest join year.

theme_gallery.question: How many exhibition are there in year 2005 or after?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT count(*) FROM exhibition WHERE YEAR  >=  2005

theme_gallery.question: Count the number of exhibitions that happened in or after 2005.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT count(*) FROM exhibition WHERE YEAR  >=  2005

theme_gallery.question: Show theme and year for all exhibitions with ticket prices lower than 15.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT theme ,  YEAR FROM exhibition WHERE ticket_price  <  15

theme_gallery.question: What are the theme and year for all exhibitions that have a ticket price under 15?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT theme ,  YEAR FROM exhibition WHERE ticket_price  <  15

theme_gallery.question: Show all artist names and the number of exhibitions for each artist.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.name ,  count(*) FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id GROUP BY T1.artist_id

theme_gallery.question: How many exhibitions has each artist had?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.name ,  count(*) FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id GROUP BY T1.artist_id

theme_gallery.question: What is the name and country for the artist with most number of exhibitions?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.name , T2.country FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id GROUP BY T1.artist_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

theme_gallery.question: Return the name and country corresponding to the artist who has had the most exhibitions.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.name , T2.country FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id GROUP BY T1.artist_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

theme_gallery.question: Show names for artists without any exhibition.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT name FROM artist WHERE artist_id NOT IN (SELECT artist_id FROM exhibition)

theme_gallery.question: What are the names of artists that have not had any exhibitions?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT name FROM artist WHERE artist_id NOT IN (SELECT artist_id FROM exhibition)

theme_gallery.question: What is the theme and artist name for the exhibition with a ticket price higher than the average?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T1.theme ,  T2.name FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id WHERE T1.ticket_price  >  (SELECT avg(ticket_price) FROM exhibition)

theme_gallery.question: Return the names of artists and the themes of their exhibitions that had a ticket price higher than average.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T1.theme ,  T2.name FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id WHERE T1.ticket_price  >  (SELECT avg(ticket_price) FROM exhibition)

theme_gallery.question: Show the average, minimum, and maximum ticket prices for exhibitions for all years before 2009.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT avg(ticket_price) ,  min(ticket_price) ,  max(ticket_price) FROM exhibition WHERE YEAR  <  2009

theme_gallery.question: What are the average, minimum, and maximum ticket prices for exhibitions that happened prior to 2009?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT avg(ticket_price) ,  min(ticket_price) ,  max(ticket_price) FROM exhibition WHERE YEAR  <  2009

theme_gallery.question: Show theme and year for all exhibitions in an descending order of ticket price.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT theme ,  YEAR FROM exhibition ORDER BY ticket_price DESC

theme_gallery.question: What are the themes and years for exhibitions, sorted by ticket price descending?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT theme ,  YEAR FROM exhibition ORDER BY ticket_price DESC

theme_gallery.question: What is the theme, date, and attendance for the exhibition in year 2004?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.theme ,  T1.date ,  T1.attendance FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T2.year  =  2004

theme_gallery.question: Return the themes, dates, and attendance for exhibitions that happened in 2004.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.theme ,  T1.date ,  T1.attendance FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T2.year  =  2004

theme_gallery.question: Show all artist names who didn't have an exhibition in 2004.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT name FROM artist EXCEPT SELECT T2.name FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id WHERE T1.year  =  2004

theme_gallery.question: What are the names of artists who did not have an exhibition in 2004?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT name FROM artist EXCEPT SELECT T2.name FROM exhibition AS T1 JOIN artist AS T2 ON T1.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id WHERE T1.year  =  2004

theme_gallery.question: Show the theme for exhibitions with both records of an attendance below 100 and above 500.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.theme FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T1.attendance  <  100 INTERSECT SELECT T2.theme FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T1.attendance  >  500

theme_gallery.question: Which themes have had corresponding exhibitions that have had attendance both below 100 and above 500?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T2.theme FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T1.attendance  <  100 INTERSECT SELECT T2.theme FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T1.attendance  >  500

theme_gallery.question: How many exhibitions have a attendance more than 100 or have a ticket price below 10?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT count(*) FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T1.attendance  >  100 OR T2.ticket_price  <  10

theme_gallery.question: Count the number of exhibitions that have had an attendnance of over 100 or a ticket prices under 10.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT count(*) FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id WHERE T1.attendance  >  100 OR T2.ticket_price  <  10

theme_gallery.question: Show all artist names with an average exhibition attendance over 200.
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T3.name FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id JOIN artist AS T3 ON T3.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id GROUP BY T3.artist_id HAVING avg(T1.attendance)  >  200

theme_gallery.question: What are the names of artist whose exhibitions draw over 200 attendees on average?
theme_gallery.query: SELECT T3.name FROM exhibition_record AS T1 JOIN exhibition AS T2 ON T1.exhibition_id  =  T2.exhibition_id JOIN artist AS T3 ON T3.artist_id  =  T2.artist_id GROUP BY T3.artist_id HAVING avg(T1.attendance)  >  200

epinions_1.question: Find the id of the item whose title is "orange".
epinions_1.query: SELECT i_id FROM item WHERE title  =  "orange"

epinions_1.question: List all information in the item table.
epinions_1.query: SELECT * FROM item

epinions_1.question: Find the number of reviews.
epinions_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM review

epinions_1.question: How many users are there?
epinions_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM useracct

epinions_1.question: Find the average and maximum rating of all reviews.
epinions_1.query: SELECT avg(rating) ,  max(rating) FROM review

epinions_1.question: Find the highest rank of all reviews.
epinions_1.query: SELECT min(rank) FROM review

epinions_1.question: How many different users wrote some reviews?
epinions_1.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT u_id) FROM review

epinions_1.question: How many different items were reviewed by some users?
epinions_1.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT i_id) FROM review

epinions_1.question: Find the number of items that did not receive any review.
epinions_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM item WHERE i_id NOT IN (SELECT i_id FROM review)

epinions_1.question: Find the names of users who did not leave any review.
epinions_1.query: SELECT name FROM useracct WHERE u_id NOT IN (SELECT u_id FROM review)

epinions_1.question: Find the names of goods that receive a rating of 10.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id WHERE T2.rating  =  10

epinions_1.question: Find the titles of items whose rating is higher than the average review rating of all items.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id WHERE T2.rating  >  (SELECT avg(rating) FROM review)

epinions_1.question: Find the titles of items that received any rating below 5.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id WHERE T2.rating  <  5

epinions_1.question: Find the titles of items that received both a rating higher than 8 and a rating below 5.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id WHERE T2.rating  >  8 INTERSECT SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id WHERE T2.rating  <  5

epinions_1.question: Find the names of items whose rank is higher than 3 and whose average rating is above 5.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id WHERE T2.rank  >  3 INTERSECT SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id GROUP BY T2.i_id HAVING avg(T2.rating)  >  5

epinions_1.question: Find the name of the item with the lowest average rating.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id GROUP BY T2.i_id ORDER BY avg(T2.rating) LIMIT 1

epinions_1.question: List the titles of all items in alphabetic order .
epinions_1.query: SELECT title FROM item ORDER BY title

epinions_1.question: Find the name of the user who gives the most reviews.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM useracct AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.u_id  =  T2.u_id GROUP BY T2.u_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

epinions_1.question: Find the name and id of the item with the highest average rating.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title ,  T1.i_id FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id GROUP BY T2.i_id ORDER BY avg(T2.rating) DESC LIMIT 1

epinions_1.question: Find the name and id of the good with the highest average rank.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.title ,  T1.i_id FROM item AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.i_id  =  T2.i_id GROUP BY T2.i_id ORDER BY avg(T2.rank) DESC LIMIT 1

epinions_1.question: For each user, return the name and the average rating of reviews given by them.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.name ,  avg(T2.rating) FROM useracct AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.u_id  =  T2.u_id GROUP BY T2.u_id

epinions_1.question: For each user, find their name and the number of reviews written by them.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.name ,  count(*) FROM useracct AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.u_id  =  T2.u_id GROUP BY T2.u_id

epinions_1.question: Find the name of the user who gave the highest rating.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM useracct AS T1 JOIN review AS T2 ON T1.u_id  =  T2.u_id ORDER BY T2.rating DESC LIMIT 1

epinions_1.question: Find the name of the source user with the highest average trust score.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM useracct AS T1 JOIN trust AS T2 ON T1.u_id  =  T2.source_u_id GROUP BY T2.source_u_id ORDER BY avg(trust) DESC LIMIT 1

epinions_1.question: Find each target user's name and average trust score.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.name ,  avg(trust) FROM useracct AS T1 JOIN trust AS T2 ON T1.u_id  =  T2.target_u_id GROUP BY T2.target_u_id

epinions_1.question: Find the name of the target user with the lowest trust score.
epinions_1.query: SELECT T1.name FROM useracct AS T1 JOIN trust AS T2 ON T1.u_id  =  T2.target_u_id ORDER BY trust LIMIT 1

epinions_1.question: Find the names of the items that did not receive any review.
epinions_1.query: SELECT title FROM item WHERE i_id NOT IN (SELECT i_id FROM review)

epinions_1.question: Find the names of users who did not leave any review.
epinions_1.query: SELECT name FROM useracct WHERE u_id NOT IN (SELECT u_id FROM review)

epinions_1.question: Find the number of users who did not write any review.
epinions_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM useracct WHERE u_id NOT IN (SELECT u_id FROM review)

epinions_1.question: Find the number of items without any review.
epinions_1.query: SELECT count(*) FROM item WHERE i_id NOT IN (SELECT i_id FROM review)

riding_club.question: List the names of players in ascending order of votes.
riding_club.query: SELECT Player_name FROM player ORDER BY Votes ASC

riding_club.question: What are the gender and occupation of players?
List the name and residence for players whose occupation is not "Researcher".
riding_club.query: SELECT Player_name ,  residence FROM player WHERE Occupation != "Researcher"

riding_club.question: Show the names of sponsors of players whose residence is either "Brandon" or "Birtle".
riding_club.query: SELECT Sponsor_name FROM player WHERE Residence  =  "Brandon" OR Residence  =  "Birtle"

riding_club.question: What is the name of the player with the largest number of votes?
riding_club.query: SELECT Player_name FROM player ORDER BY Votes DESC LIMIT 1

riding_club.question: Show different occupations along with the number of players in each occupation.
riding_club.query: SELECT Occupation ,  COUNT(*) FROM player GROUP BY Occupation

riding_club.question: Please show the most common occupation of players.
riding_club.query: SELECT Occupation FROM player GROUP BY Occupation ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1

riding_club.question: Show the residences that have at least two players.
riding_club.query: SELECT Residence FROM player GROUP BY Residence HAVING COUNT(*)  >=  2

riding_club.question: Show the names of players and names of their coaches.
riding_club.query: SELECT T3.Player_name ,  T2.coach_name FROM player_coach AS T1 JOIN coach AS T2 ON T1.Coach_ID  =  T2.Coach_ID JOIN player AS T3 ON T1.Player_ID  =  T3.Player_ID

riding_club.question: Show the names of players coached by the rank 1 coach.
riding_club.query: SELECT T3.Player_name FROM player_coach AS T1 JOIN coach AS T2 ON T1.Coach_ID  =  T2.Coach_ID JOIN player AS T3 ON T1.Player_ID  =  T3.Player_ID WHERE T2.Rank  =  1

riding_club.question: Show the names and genders of players with a coach starting after 2011.
riding_club.query: SELECT T3.Player_name ,  T3.gender FROM player_coach AS T1 JOIN coach AS T2 ON T1.Coach_ID  =  T2.Coach_ID JOIN player AS T3 ON T1.Player_ID  =  T3.Player_ID WHERE T1.Starting_year  >  2011

riding_club.question: Show the names of players and names of their coaches in descending order of the votes of players.
riding_club.query: SELECT T3.Player_name ,  T2.coach_name FROM player_coach AS T1 JOIN coach AS T2 ON T1.Coach_ID  =  T2.Coach_ID JOIN player AS T3 ON T1.Player_ID  =  T3.Player_ID ORDER BY T3.Votes DESC

riding_club.question: List the names of players that do not have coaches.
riding_club.query: SELECT Player_name FROM player WHERE Player_ID NOT IN (SELECT Player_ID FROM player_coach)

riding_club.question: Show the residences that have both a player of gender "M" and a player of gender "F".
riding_club.query: SELECT Residence FROM player WHERE gender  =  "M" INTERSECT SELECT Residence FROM player WHERE gender  =  "F"

riding_club.question: How many coaches does each club has? List the club id, name and the number of coaches.
riding_club.query: SELECT T1.club_id ,  T1.club_name, count(*) FROM club AS T1 JOIN coach AS T2 ON T1.club_id  =  T2.club_id GROUP BY T1.club_id

riding_club.question: How many gold medals has the club with the most coaches won?
riding_club.query: SELECT T1.club_id ,  T1.gold FROM match_result AS T1 JOIN coach AS T2 ON T1.club_id  =  T2.club_id GROUP BY T1.club_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1
